biblinkcreator

Class StringOperation

  • java.lang.Object
    • biblinkcreator.StringOperation

  • public class StringOperation
extends java.lang.Object
    A class providing basic string operations for the identifier, title and year.

    Author: David Nazarian

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  StringOperation.StringReplacementType
      An enumeration for the type of string replacement.

                                            java.lang.String replacementStr)
        Replaces the control characters of the input string with a specified string.
        Parameters:
        str - The input string.
        replacementStr - The string to replace the control characters.
        Returns:
        A string with replaced control characters.

        Parameters:

        replacementData - The list of the replacements.
        Returns:

      • replaceSymbols

        public java.lang.String replaceSymbols(java.lang.String str)
        Replaces the symbols contained in the symbols array from the input string, with a single space.
        Parameters:
        str - The input string.
        Returns:
        A string with replaced symbols.

      • formatArXivID

        public DataStructure.StringFormatResult formatArXivID(java.lang.String arxivID,
                                                      java.util.List<DataStructure.StringReplacementData> replacementData)
        Validates and formats a provided arXiv identifier and returns it accompanied by a value indicating its validity. For information about the structure of the identifier please visit the following address:
        https://arxiv.org/help/arxiv_identifier
        Parameters:
        arxivID - The arXiv identifier to be validated and formatted.
        replacementData - (Optional) The string replacements before validation and formatting.
        Returns:
        A string format result containing the validated and formatted identifier and a value indicating its validity.

      • formatDOI

        public DataStructure.StringFormatResult formatDOI(java.lang.String doi,
                                                  java.util.List<DataStructure.StringReplacementData> replacementData)
        Validates and formats a provided DOI and returns it accompanied by a value indicating its validity. For information about the structure of the identifier please visit the following address:
        https://www.doi.org/doi_handbook/2_Numbering.html
        Parameters:
        doi - The Digital Object Identifier (DOI) to be validated and formatted.
        replacementData - (Optional) The string replacements before validation and formatting.
        Returns:
        A string format result containing the validated and formatted identifier and a value indicating its validity.

      • formatISBN

        public DataStructure.StringFormatResult formatISBN(java.lang.String isbn,
                                                   java.util.List<DataStructure.StringReplacementData> replacementData)
        Validates and formats a provided ISBN (including a conversion to an ISBN13 if it represents an ISBN10) and returns it accompanied by a value indicating its validity. For information about the structure of the identifier please visit the following address:
        https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Standard_Book_Number
        Parameters:
        isbn - The International Standard Book Number (ISBN) to be validated and formatted.
        replacementData - (Optional) The string replacements before validation and formatting.
        Returns:
        A string format result containing the validated and formatted identifier and a value indicating its validity.

      • formatISSN

        public DataStructure.StringFormatResult formatISSN(java.lang.String issn,
                                                   java.util.List<DataStructure.StringReplacementData> replacementData)
        Validates and formats a provided ISSN and returns it accompanied by a value indicating its validity. For information about the structure of the identifier please visit the following address:
        https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/International_Standard_Serial_Number
        Parameters:
        issn - The International Standard Serial Number (ISSN) to be validated and formatted.
        replacementData - (Optional) The string replacements before validation and formatting.
        Returns:
        A string format result containing the validated and formatted identifier and a value indicating its validity.

      • formatLCCN

        public DataStructure.StringFormatResult formatLCCN(java.lang.String lccn,
                                                   java.util.List<DataStructure.StringReplacementData> replacementData)
        Validates and formats a provided LCCN (including its normalization) and returns it accompanied by a value indicating its validity. For information about the structure of the identifier please visit the following addresses:
        https://www.loc.gov/marc/lccn_structure.html
        https://www.loc.gov/marc/lccn-namespace.html
        Parameters:
        lccn - The Library of Congress Control Number (LCCN) to be validated and formatted.
        replacementData - (Optional) The string replacements before validation and formatting.
        Returns:
        A string format result containing the validated and formatted identifier and a value indicating its validity.

      • formatOCLC

        public DataStructure.StringFormatResult formatOCLC(java.lang.String oclc,
                                                   java.util.List<DataStructure.StringReplacementData> replacementData)
        Validates and formats a provided OCLC identifier and returns it accompanied by a value indicating its validity. For more information about the structure of the number visit the following address:
        https://www.oclc.org/batchload/controlnumber.en.html
        Parameters:
        oclc - The Online Computer Library Center (OCLC) identifier to be validated and formatted.
        replacementData - (Optional) The string replacements before validation and formatting.
        Returns:
        A string format result containing the validated and formatted identifier and a value indicating its validity.

      • formatPMID

        public DataStructure.StringFormatResult formatPMID(java.lang.String pmid,
                                                   java.util.List<DataStructure.StringReplacementData> replacementData)
        Validates and formats a provided PMID and returns it accompanied by a value indicating its validity. For more information about the structure of the identifier visit the following address:
        https://www.oclc.org/batchload/controlnumber.en.html
        Parameters:
        pmid - The PubMed identifier (PMID) to be validated and formatted.
        replacementData - (Optional) The string replacements before validation and formatting.
        Returns:
        A string format result containing the validated and formatted identifier and a value indicating its validity.

        Parameters:

        replacementData - (Optional) The string replacements before validation and formatting.
        Returns:
        A string format result containing the validated and formatted title and a value indicating its validity.

      • formatIdentifier

        public DataStructure.StringFormatResult formatIdentifier(java.lang.String identifierString,
                                                         Identifier.IdentifierType identifierType,
                                                         DataStructure.StringFormatData stringFormatData)
        Validates and formats a provided identifier string.
        Parameters:
        identifierString - The identifier string to be validates and formatted.
        identifierType - The type of the input string identifier.
        stringFormatData - The string format data for the identifier.
        Returns:
        A string format result containing the validated and formatted identifier and a value indicating its validity.
